page.title: 02M.V. ISLE OF ARRAN
page.content: The M.V. Isle of Arran is the car ferry which serves as the island's main link with the mainland. She is capable of carrying 80 cars or 36 cars and 10 commercial vehicles or coaches and 500 passengers in the summer service. The ferry cost Â£6.7m to build, was launched on 12th December 1983 and first called at Brodick on 5th April 1984. Owned by Caledonian MacBrayne who serve 22 other Scottish islands, she started her service on 13th April 1984. Carrying the island's supplies of food, newspapers and mail, the ferry takes 55 minutes to travel from Ardrossan to Arran. If, however, the weather is stormy, she sails to Gourock which takes approximately 2 hours.
